bioghist.p: The Biodiversity Research Group of the Academy of Natural Sciences, now known as the Center for Systematic Biology and Evolution, cares for and expands the Academy of Natural Sciences' natural history collections. The scientists at the Center conduct significant research into biodiversity, ecology, evolution, molecular systematics and paleontology.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of administrative files from the Biodiversity Research Group of the Academy of Natural Sciences. The papers cover the period from 1966 to 1994. Materials include: annual reports for the division (1974-1988, some years missing) and reports and memos of departments within the division; administrative staff council minutes and library committee memos; Academy monthly activity reports (1987 and 1988); records related to division goals and research strategies; documentation related to exhibits and special projects; correspondence about grants, involvement with professional organizations, fundraising, publications, honorary positions in the division, and research projects. The collection also includes a bound volume: "Long Range Planning for Systematics and Evolutionary Biology," prepared by George M. Davis and staff in 1983.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
